about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:

about.name: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should: | You are approaching an intersection at the posted speed limit when the signal turns yellow. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.

comment.text: Slow down and proceed through the intersection without caution.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

comment.text: Speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.

comment.text: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.

comment.text: Stop before entering the intersection, if you can do so safely.

answerExplanation.text: A solid yellow light means "caution" and signals that the light will soon turn red. You should stop at a solid yellow light if you can do so safely; otherwise, you should cautiously cross the intersection.

hasPart.name: There are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right. You should steer:

about.name: There are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right. You should steer:

hasPart.text: If there are oncoming vehicles to your left and a row of parked vehicles to your right, the best thing to do is to split the difference. Steer a middle course between the oncoming cars and the parked cars.

suggestedAnswer.text: Closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles.

comment.text: Closer to the oncoming vehicles than the parked vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: Closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles.

comment.text: Closer to the parked vehicles than the oncoming vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.

comment.text: A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.

acceptedAnswer.text: A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.

comment.text: A middle course between the oncoming and parked vehicles.

hasPart.name: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:

about.name: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:

hasPart.assesses: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means: | A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should speed up so you can make the turn before the light changes.

comment.text: You should speed up so you can make the turn before the light changes.

suggestedAnswer.text: You do not need to signal to turn from the indicated lane.

comment.text: You do not need to signal to turn from the indicated lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.

comment.text: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.

comment.text: You should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic.

answerExplanation.text: A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

comment.text: A solid yellow arrow on a traffic signal means: | A solid yellow arrow means that the protection of a green arrow is ending. If you are turning in the direction of the arrow, you should prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic before turning.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This particular sign tells you the maximum speed limit for the stretch of highway where it is posted. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed limit.

comment.text: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.

comment.text: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must not travel below the speed indicated.

comment.text: You must not travel below the speed indicated.

acceptedAnswer.text: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.

comment.text: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions is 55 mph.

answerExplanation.text: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. This particular sign tells you the maximum speed limit for the stretch of highway where it is posted. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit.

hasPart.name: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:

about.name: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should: | If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

comment.text: Not turn your steering wheel.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.

comment.text: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.

comment.text: Turn your steering wheel to the right to correct the skid.

acceptedAnswer.text: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.

comment.text: Turn your steering wheel to the left to correct the skid.

answerExplanation.text: If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.

comment.text: If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the left, you should: | If you begin to skid on a wet or icy road, take your foot off the accelerator, stay off the brakes, and turn your steering wheel in the direction of the skid. However, if you have anti-lock brakes, you should apply your brakes firmly and steer straight ahead.
